sections.description: Static HTML assets for the live PlantUML editor web interface, embedded in the server binary at compile time.
sections.purpose: Provides a self-contained, interactive web editor that allows users to write PlantUML diagrams and see real-time SVG previews in the browser. The single HTML file contains all HTML markup, CSS styling, and JavaScript logic needed to communicate with the HTTP server's /render endpoint. This enables the server to be distributed as a single binary without external file dependencies.
strengths: Self-contained single HTML file with no external dependencies
Embedded directly into Go binary using go:embed, eliminating file dependencies
Real-time rendering with 300ms debounce to avoid excessive server requests
Responsive dark-themed UI with split editor/preview layout
Clean error display with line and column information from server
Keyboard-friendly with proper focus and standard editor shortcuts
weaknesses: All styling and logic inline in single file makes maintenance harder than separate CSS/JS
No syntax highlighting for PlantUML code in editor
Limited accessibility features (no ARIA labels, no keyboard navigation hints)
Error messages depend on server validation, no client-side hints
Fixed default diagram makes it less welcoming for new users wanting to start blank
sections.test_coverage: Tested indirectly through server_test.go's TestServer cases: GetEditor test verifies HTML loads correctly with expected elements (textarea, go-uml title, /render reference); PostRender tests verify the client-side fetch logic works with valid/invalid/empty inputs by checking server responses.
sections.dependencies: No external dependencies. Depends on internal server module to embed this directory and serve it via handleEditor() function. The embedded JavaScript calls the /render POST endpoint which depends on internal/encoding and pkg/gouml for diagram processing.
sections.functionality: Delivers the interactive web UI that enables live editing and preview of PlantUML diagrams. Provides textarea for diagram input, renders SVG output, displays validation errors with location info, and includes status indicators. The JavaScript handles debounced requests to server, error formatting, and real-time UI updates.
